results.title: The Magic touch
results.creator_credit: V. Shantaram, Films Division, Government of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: A visual impression of Indian arts and crafts, recording the skill of the country’s artisans. Shows filigree from Cuttack and Hyderabad, the enamelled brassware of Moradabad, Jaipur and Lucknow, bronze figures from South India, ivory models wrought in Mysore and Travancore, the papiermache work from Kashmir.

results.title: The Magic square
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and General Learning Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents basic mathematical concepts. Crow and the Count travel to Scotland to claim an inherited castle. The benefactor has left a fortune to the person who can solve the mystery of the magic square. This the two friends do after much juggling of numbers; the reshuffling illustrates the interchangeability of addends in an addition equation (associative property). Previewing recommended for follow-up work for teachers. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The magic school bus explores the solar system (PC)
results.brief_description: Take an interplanetary adventure as the Magic School Bus blasts off into the solar system. Ms Frizzle gets lost in space! It’s your mission to collect clues, discover the secrets of the solar system, and find the friz to win the game. SYSTEMS REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatible with 486SX or higher microprocessor, 25MHz, 4MB of RAM, at least 5MB of available hard disk space, double speed CDROM drive, 8-bit audio board, and SVGA display capable of 256 colours. MS-DOS version 5.1 ot later, Microsoft Windows, version 3.1 or later.

results.title: The Magic school bus explores the human body (PC)
results.brief_description: Join Ms. Frizzle and the class on a wacky trip into Arnold’s body. Along the way you will explore how the human body works as you discover a way out of Arnold and win the game. STYSTEMS REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatible with a 486SX or higher microprocessor, 25MHz, 4MB of RAM, at least 5MB of available hard-disk space, double speed CDROM drive, 8-bit audio board, and SVGA display capable of 256 colours. MS-DOS operating system version 5.0 or later. Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: The Magic scarab: superstition
results.creator_credit: Marshall Izen and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
This film uses a puppet story to explore the fallacy of belief in superstition, emphasizing self-reliance. It shows how Oni and the other puppets find out whether or not a good-luck charm really works when Oni reluctantly enters the spelling contest without it. Awards: two Emmy awards. Voices by Ruth Franklin and Marshall Izen. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

group_siblings.title: Taffy's imagination: fear of the dark

results.title: The Magic Roundabout
results.brief_description: The Magic Roundabout is about Mr. Rusty’s magic garden. He’s 100 years old and moves very fast because there’s always something to do. Then there’s Mr. Zebedee, the magic Jack-in-the-Box. He brings Florence and the other children to the garden to meet Dougal, the lovable but temperamental Scottie dog, Dylan the laid-back rabbit, Ermintrude the delightful felt hatted cow, and Brian the happy-go-lucky snail.

results.title: The Magic rectangle: short multiplication
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math that counts”.
Uses rectangular arrays of square metres as a visual model for multiplication and explains the commutative property of multiplication.

results.title: The Magic pear tree
results.creator_credit: Film Dimensions, Wan-go Wen and Alfred Wallace
results.brief_description: A tale about a pear peddler who is greedy and selfish, a poor old man who couldn’t afford to buy a pear, and a kind passer-by who buys a pear for the old man. Points out that we should have compassion for the poor and respect for the elderly.

results.title: The Magic Paintbrush
results.brief_description: A charming puppet animation based on a Chinese folk-tale. Ma Liang, the hero, is a poor peasant boy who loves to paint. One day a fairy gives him a magic paintbrush and he discovers that anything he paints will come to life. Ma Liang happily creates many things that the peasants desperately need until, one fateful day, a wicked landlord discovers his secret.
